content: Your user type has been changed to <1>“{{userType}}”</1> by the {{productName}} admin <1>{{adminName}}</1>.

comment.text: This translation key displays a message when a user's type changes, indicating the new user type and who made the change. It is used in a modal dialog to notify users of an administrative action taken by the admin.

usage.context:
<ModalDialog.Header>{t("Common:Warning")}</ModalDialog.Header>
 <ModalDialog.Body>
 <Trans
 t={t}
 ns="Files"
 i18nKey="YourUserTypeHasChanged"
 values={{
 userType: t("Common:Guest"),
 productName: t("Common:ProductName"),
 adminName,
 }}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Arabic translation maintains the XML-like tags (<1> and </1>) which are unnecessary in a user-facing message. These tags are remnants of the original English content’s formatting and should be removed for clarity and natural language flow.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: تم تغيير نوع المستخدم الخاص بكم إلى «{{userType}}» من قِبل مسؤول {{productName}} {{adminName}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "olaraq dəyişdirilib" literally translates to 'was changed to'. A more natural phrasing in Azerbaijani for 'has been changed to' would be 'dəyişdirilib'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: İstifadəçi tipiniz {{productName}} administratoru <1>{{adminName}}</1> tərəfindən <1>“{{userType}}”</1> dəyişdirilib.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word order is slightly awkward. Putting 'tərəfindən' earlier would flow better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: İstifadəçi tipiniz {{productName}} administratoru <1>{{adminName}}</1> tərəfindən <1>“{{userType}}”</1> dəyişdirilib.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "Your user type has been changed to" is better translated as "Ihr Benutzertyp wurde auf... geändert" or "Ihr Benutzertyp wurde in... geändert" in German.  The current translation, 'Ihr Benutzertyp wurde... in...' is grammatically awkward and doesn't flow naturally.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ihr Benutzertyp wurde auf “{{userType}}” geändert.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The closing angle bracket placement in the German translation is slightly off compared to the English. It is better to maintain the identical placement of angle brackets in the original and translated text.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ihr Benutzertyp wurde vom {{productName}}-Administrator <1>{{adminName}}</1> in <1>”{{userType}}”</1> geändert.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Greek translation maintains the HTML tags (<1> and </1>) from the English source. While technically correct, this is likely unnecessary and could negatively impact rendering depending on the context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing the <1> and </1> tags if they are not required for the intended display.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, using 'από τον διαχειριστή' (by the administrator) is a bit formal. A more natural phrasing might be preferable depending on the desired tone.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like 'από διαχειριστή' (by administrator) or a more conversational phrasing.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Su tipo de usuario se ha cambiado a" is slightly awkward in Spanish. A more natural phrasing would be "Su tipo de usuario fue cambiado a" or "Su tipo de usuario ha sido cambiado a".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Su tipo de usuario fue cambiado a

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "on vaihtanut käyttäjätyypiksesi" is a literal translation of "has changed your user type". A more natural and idiomatic Finnish phrasing would be something like "on muuttanut käyttäjätyyppisi".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: on muuttanut käyttäjätyyppisi

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>` tags in the original English template are being replicated in the Finnish translation. While technically correct to maintain the same structure, it's stylistically unusual in Finnish.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing the `<1>` tags to improve readability in Finnish. If preservation of this structure is essential, ensure consistency throughout all translations using this format.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'pääkäyttäjä' (main user) might not be the most accurate translation of 'admin' in this context. It suggests a specific role rather than a general administrator.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'ylläpitäjä' (maintainer) or simply omitting the role and implying the action was performed by an administrator.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Your user type has been changed to" is not ideally translated as "Votre type d'utilisateur a été modifié en". A more natural phrasing would be "Votre type d'utilisateur a été changé en".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Votre type d'utilisateur a été changé en

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'ադմին' is a transliteration of 'admin' and might not be the most natural or understandable term in Armenian. A more appropriate translation for 'admin' in this context would be 'գործակալ' or 'վարչակազմ'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Օգտատիրոջ տեսակը փոխվել է <1>«{{userType}}»</1> by the {{productName}} գործակալ <1>{{adminName}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English sentence contains tags <1>...</1>. While preserved in the Armenian translation, it’s not clear why these are necessary and if they align with Armenian formatting conventions.  It's possible these were meant to be HTML or XML tags that are not relevant in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Evaluate whether these tags are needed in the Armenian translation. If they are not essential for rendering or data processing, they can be removed.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Your user type has been changed to" is translated as "Il tuo tipo di utente è stato modificato in". While technically correct, a more natural and common phrasing in Italian would be "Il tuo tipo di utente è stato cambiato in".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Il tuo tipo di utente è stato cambiato in

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Japanese translation places the quotes around the user type *after* the phrase "に変更されました". The English puts it in front. This changes the emphasis and natural flow. The quotes should precede '{{userType}}'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: あなたのユーザータイプは、{{productName}}管理者<1>{{adminName}}</1>によって<1>“{{userType}}”</1>に変更されました。 should become あなたのユーザータイプは、{{productName}}管理者<1>{{adminName}}</1>によって<1>“{{userType}}”</1>に変更されました。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, “に変更されました” (ni henka saremashita) sounds a bit formal and stiff for a user type change notification. A more natural phrasing might be desirable depending on the tone of the application.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like “に変更されています” (ni henka sareteimasu) or a more conversational phrasing appropriate for the application's overall tone.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase '사용자 유형이 ... (으)로 변경되었습니다' is a bit awkward. A more natural translation for 'Your user type has been changed to...' would be something like '사용자 유형이 ... 로 변경되었습니다' or '사용자 유형을 ... 로 변경되었습니다'. The '(으)로' makes the sentence slightly stilted.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 사용자 유형이 {{productName}} 관리자 <1>{{adminName}}</1>님에 의해 <1>“{{userType}}”</1>(으)로 변경되었습니다. -> 사용자 유형을 {{productName}} 관리자 <1>{{adminName}}</1>님에 의해 <1>“{{userType}}”</1>(으)로 변경되었습니다. or 사용자 유형이 {{productName}} 관리자 <1>{{adminName}}</1>님에 의해 <1>“{{userType}}”</1>로 변경되었습니다.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>` tags seem misplaced in the Korean translation. They appear *after* the user type, whereas in the English, they surround the user type and the admin name. This can impact readability and may indicate an issue with how the translated content will be rendered.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider matching the placement of the `<1>` tags to the English content: '{{productName}} 관리자 <1>{{adminName}}</1>님에 의해 <1>“{{userType}}”</1>로 변경되었습니다.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "Your user type has been changed to" is not accurately reflected in the Latvian translation. "ir mainījis jūsu lietotāja tipu uz" is a more literal translation of "has changed your user type to", but sounds less natural. A better phrasing might convey the sense of 'your user type was changed to'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider rephrasing to something like "Jūsu lietotāja tips ir ticis mainīts uz" or "Jūsu lietotāja tipu ir mainīts uz".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The formatting tags <1>...</1> are not standard in Latvian translations. They appear to be placeholders for the named entities. This formatting does not need to be preserved.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the <1>...</1> tags from the translated content.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'utilizador' should be 'usuário' in Brazilian Portuguese. 'Utilizador' is more common in European Portuguese.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: O seu usuário foi alterado para <1>“{{userType}}”</1> pelo administrador {{productName}} <1>{{adminName}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The spacing before the <1> tag in the English version is missing in the Portuguese translation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: O seu usuário foi alterado para <1>“{{userType}}”</1> pelo administrador {{productName}} <1>{{adminName}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Your user type has been changed" is better translated as "Tipul tău de utilizator a fost schimbat” instead of simply "Tipul de utilizator a fost schimbat". The direct translation lacks the possessive indicating it's the user's type.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Tipul tău de utilizator a fost schimbat în <1>“{{userType}}”</1> de către administratorul  <1>{{adminName}}</1> al {{productName}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets '<1>' and '</1>' are present in both the English and Russian versions. While technically correct, they're likely meant for internal processing and don't need to be displayed to the user.  Consider removing them.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the '<1>' and '</1>' tags from the Russian translation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Sinhala translation retains the HTML tags <1>...</1> which are unnecessary and disrupt the flow of the sentence. These tags should be removed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the <1>...</1> tags entirely.  The sentence should read: “ඔබේ පරිශීලක වර්ගය “{{userType}}” ලෙසින් {{productName}} පරිපාලකයෙකු වන {{adminName}} විසින් වෙනස් කර ඇත.”

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'leasın' in the translation 'leasın' is a less common and potentially incorrect way to express 'to'. It's possible it's trying to represent 'as' or 'into', but a more standard translation might be better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace 'leasın' with a more common alternative such as 'වන' or 'යට'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "Your user type has been changed to" is not perfectly translated in Slovak. A more natural translation would be "Váš používateľský typ bol zmenený na" or "Zmenili sa vaše nastavenia používateľského typu na".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Váš používateľský typ bol zmenený na

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English uses angled brackets to enclose tags. This is replicated in the Slovak translation. Consider whether this is the desired format; it may be cleaner to remove the brackets.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Váš používateľský typ bol zmenený na “{{userType}}” administrátorom {{productName}} {{adminName}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation of "Your user type has been changed to" is not accurate. "Vaš tip uporabnika je spremenil v" literally translates to "Your user type has changed into". A more appropriate translation would be something like "Vaš tip uporabnika je bil spremenjen na" or "Vaš tip uporabnika je bil posodobljen na".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Vaš tip uporabnika je bil spremenjen na

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Slovenian translation uses quotes (« ») around the user type, but the English source uses angle brackets (<1>). This is an inconsistency and should be reviewed for consistency.  Ideally, angle brackets would also be used in the Slovenian translation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using angle brackets (<1>) instead of quotes (« ») for consistency with the English source.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The sentence structure is a bit awkward.  Adding a preposition could improve readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider revising the sentence to 'Vaš tip uporabnika je bil spremenjen na «{{userType}}» skrbnikom za {{productName}} <1>{{adminName}}</1>.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The format tags <1> and </1> are inconsistent. They are used for both userType and adminName.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent formatting across all elements. Consider if this formatting is necessary or if a more standard approach would be preferable.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'promenjen' (changed) sounds slightly awkward in this context. 'Izmenjen' would be more natural for 'changed' when referring to a status or setting.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Vaš tip korisnika je izmenjen na <1>“{{userType}}”</1> od strane administratora {{productName}} <1>{{adminName}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrasing "Kullanıcı türünüz, ... olarak değiştirildi" is a bit awkward. A more natural Turkish phrasing would be something like "Kullanıcı türünüz ...'ye değiştirildi" or "Kullanıcı türünüz ... şeklinde değiştirildi".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Kullanıcı türünüz ...'ye değiştirildi.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The placement of the brackets <1>...</1> around '{{adminName}}' is consistent with the English but isn't a typical convention in Turkish. It implies a special markup which isn't immediately clear in purpose.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the <1> and </1> tags around {{adminName}}. The context should dictate if these tags are essential.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Loại người dùng của bạn đã được...thay đổi thành" is a bit awkward. A more natural phrasing would be "Loại người dùng của bạn đã được thay đổi thành..." or "Quyền truy cập của bạn đã được thay đổi thành..."
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Loại người dùng của bạn đã được thay đổi thành

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'quản trị viên' (admin) is accurate but consider a more user-friendly term like 'người quản lý' or 'nhân viên' depending on the context and brand voice.  'Quản trị viên' can sound formal and potentially intimidating to some users.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: người quản lý

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "更改为" (gǎi gēng wèi) for 'changed to' is technically correct, but a more natural and common phrasing would be "修改为" (xiū gǎi wèi) or simply "变为" (biàn wéi). '更改' can imply a more significant or forced change, which might not be the intended meaning.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 您的用户类型已被{{productName}}管理员<1>{{adminName}}</1>修改为 <1>“{{userType}}”</1>。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The <1> tags surrounding "{{adminName}}" are inconsistent with the tags around "{{userType}}". They should be consistent.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 您的用户类型已被{{productName}}管理员<1>{{adminName}}</1>更改为 <1>“{{userType}}”</1>。
